meanings.definition: The state or quality of not being uniform.
meanings.sent1: The nonuniformity of the colors in the painting made it look messy.
meanings.sent2: The nonuniformity of the students' heights made it challenging to take a class photo.
meanings.sent3: The nonuniformity of the cupcakes' sizes made them look like a quirky family of desserts.
meanings.sent4: The nonuniformity of the stars in the sky resembled scattered jewels on black velvet.
meanings.sent5: The nonuniformity of the garden's flowers created a vibrant and dynamic display.

meanings.sent1: The nonuniformity of the weather patterns confused the meteorologists.
meanings.sent2: The nonuniformity of the handwriting made it difficult to read the notes.
meanings.sent3: The nonuniformity of the traffic lights caused chaos at the intersection.
meanings.sent4: The nonuniformity of the music volume in the room created a jarring experience.
meanings.sent5: The nonuniformity of the puzzle pieces made it challenging to complete the picture.
